body: because dagActionQueue is threadsafe, two threads should not pull out the same dag action and try to set reminder for it. it seems there is something more to this issue.
You can also add the details from the ticket you've created to this PR details as well: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GOBBLIN-2087

> Most of the diff in the PR is because of the refactoring. Can you explain what were the changes that helped get rid of this todo
> 
> ```
> // todo - fix bug of a reminder event getting a lease even when the first attempt succeeded.
>             // for now, avoid processing reminder events if they are not for deadline dag actions
> ```

yes the main change is storing eventTimestamp from the first leaseAttemptStatus in the DagActionReminderScheduler and using that when trying lease on reminder MALA. Otherwise it would use current ts as the eventTimestamp and treat every reminder as new event and do duplicate processing of dagAction once for original once for reminder

this code piece to retrieve the event time

  ```
    long eventTimeMillis = jobDataMap.getLong(FLOW_ACTION_EVENT_TIME_KEY);

      DagActionStore.DagActionLeaseObject reminderDagActionLeaseObject = new DagActionStore.DagActionLeaseObject(
          new DagActionStore.DagAction(flowGroup, flowName, flowExecutionId, jobName, dagActionType),
          true, eventTimeMillis);
```

checks on my branch https://github.com/umustafi/gobblin/pull/29/checks

the data inside the data map is not being "deep" copied or cloned. the change is only creating new data map object and inserting the same old K,V objects inside that.
at the same time, i see that reminder has a unique key differentiating it from the original event by `reminderSuffix`. i am not able to understand the root cause of the issue as well as the fix.

"...all subsequent scheduler triggers after the very first one are incorrectly marked as reminders even when they are for "original" events."
what is "original" event here? why are subsequent scheduler triggers not reminders?

> the data inside the data map is not being "deep" copied or cloned. the change is only creating new data map object and inserting the same old K,V objects inside that. at the same time, i see that reminder has a unique key differentiating it from the original event by `reminderSuffix`. i am not able to understand the root cause of the issue as well as the fix.

the bug was that whenever scheduler trigger fires, it checks if something is a reminder or not by using this flag `ConfigurationKeys.FLOW_IS_REMINDER_EVENT_KEY` but we were adding this value in the shallow copy of the Properties obj so even for "original" events (adhoc or scheduled flow) it is appearing as a reminder. Reminder should be a distinct job set in Scheduler after doing lease arbitration over the original trigger (flow X fired at time Y).

How about having a SKIPPED status, instead of FAILED, when the dag is not run because another flow is runnings.
@Will-Lo  you had some opinion about this. Can you remind me?

> How about having a SKIPPED status, instead of FAILED, when the dag is not run because another flow is runnings. @Will-Lo you had some opinion about this. Can you remind me?

Hey @arjun4084346 , But we still will need to check all the flow statuses in the resume flow case  scenario as was mentioned by @abhishekmjain . For ex : Given flow, flowExecId1 got failed, flowExecId2 completed successfully, but someone triggered resume command for flowExecId1. In this case, for flowExecId3 to run non-concurrently, we need to check for flowExecId1's running status right, even though it is not the latest flowExecId.

@arjun4084346 @pratapaditya04 
Ideally we do have a skipped flow status, and ideally this can just be all detected during query time when fetching the job statuses such that iteration isn't needed. The challenge with the skipped flow status is that introducing another flow status will change a few of the clients in Gobblin-as-a-Service, so care should be taken to introduce these semantics and the ramifications need to be well understood. I consider that outside of the scope of this PR which focuses primarily on fixing this concurrency bug.

I found out a bug internally where theres discrepancy between java.utils.Properties and Azkaban prop object during props passing, thats results in parent config is not pass all the way down to `TimeBasedSnapshotCleanupPolicy.java` in runtime.

I've reverted TimeBasedSnapshotCleanupPolicy to original code, and tested are expected.  the However, i've added unit tests `TimeBasedSnapshotCleanupPolicyTest` ensuring the test coverage.

During investigation, also found a bug (in Trash.java) where Trash use `props.contains(TRASH_CLASS_KEY))` which leads to unexpected evalation whereas the intention is to `props.containsKey(TRASH_CLASS_KEY))`
